column4: hi people.. i have a weird problem.. after struggling with x while getting the resolution to work, suddenly the mouse cursor dissapeard.. what could i have done wrong?
when the cursor disappears, are the Capslock and ScrollLock lights on your keyboard blinking on and off?
no.. now i realize the caps lock even doesn't work.. damn
Did you hand-edit the xorg.conf file when you were fiddling with resolutions?
no.. i did it with dpkg-reconfigure, but i really have **no** idea what i've changed at all..
Ah, when dpkg-reconfigure command - was it   sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver.xorg   or was it missing the -phigh part?
it was missing the phigh part

OK. Re-run the command without -phigh one more time. then when it asks about your mouse device put /dev/psaux if it's a ps2 mouse or /dev/ttyS0 if it's a serial mouse or the recommended one if it's a usb
the mouse is a laptop mouse, is it then a serial one?
For just changing resolutions, sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg   next time :) It won't bug you about allt he devices etc etc
ok.. thanks.. i didn't know that..
also there should be a backed up copy of xorg.conf date-stamped. you can restore your old one by copying it over the messy current xorg.conf
work calls me away for a minute but i have not left, checking msgs, scroll when I get i return
ok.. i'm going to restart x now, see if it worked.. will let u know
